Egypt, added the statement, recognized and appreciated the care accorded by Germany to the painted limestone bust of the famous ancient Egyptian queen, but added: Egypt is confident that the German authorities will assist in facilitating its return. The government and people of Egypt are eager that this unique treasure be returned to the possession of its rightful owners, the Egyptian people. If returned, Zahi Hawass said, the bust will be exhibited at a new museum south of Cairo. if you count Yahoo, and Eric Schmidt recently said in Davos that Facebook is not competition, that it has no intention of going into search. On its face, it seems like a very lopsided duopoly. From my perspective, competition is always a click away. If we don't do the right thing by our users, it takes one word in their browser bar to go to another search engine. We don't even know how the information seeking model will evolve. What you may not think of as competitive today, might very well become the new way of seeking information.
